summary: toxoplasma gondii is an intracellular protozoan parasite that infects a wide variety of warm-blooded hosts, including humans. a total of 626 bats representing 10 species were examined for T. gondii infection, 38 (6.1%) were tested positive with PCR, 8 positive DNA samples were completely genotyped. reported two T. gondii genotypes (ToxoDB#9 and #10) have a wide geographical distribution in china. these results provide new genetic information about T. gondii infection in bats.
